title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
The chip industry is adjusting to a wider and sharper slowdown than it anticipated even as semiconductor firms prepare to spend billions of dollars on new factories.

Coinbase reported a loss of $1.1 billion for the second quarter, driven by the cryptocurrency market's spring meltdown.

Ford will raise prices for its new all-electric truck less than four months after it started shipping the vehicle to dealerships.

Musk sold Tesla stock valued at nearly $7 billion in recent days, just months after saying he wasn't planning to sell additional shares in the company.

U.S. stock indexes closed lower, with the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow industrials falling 0.4%, 1.2% and 0.2%, respectively.

AppLovin proposed a merger with Unity Software through an all-stock deal that would value Unity at $17.5 billion.

Walmart is looking to add a large video streaming service to its Walmart+ membership program, according to people familiar with the situation.

What's News: Business & Finance
